User Story: As a player, I want to access my journal during gameplay so I can refresh my memory about past events.
Acceptance Criteria:
The journal interface can be opened from the main game session UI
Opening the journal preserves the current game session state
Journal access is available at any point during gameplay
The journal opens with a smooth transition
Opening the journal doesn't interrupt the narrative flow

User Story: As a player, I want to navigate back to the game without losing my game state so I can seamlessly continue playing.
Acceptance Criteria:
A clearly visible 'Back' or 'Close' button returns to the game session
The game state is preserved exactly as it was before opening the journal
The transition back to the game is smooth and intuitive
No progress or context is lost when returning to the game
The journal state is preserved for the next access

User Story: As a player, I want to see journal entries in chronological order so I can follow the story progression.
Acceptance Criteria:
The EntryList component displays entries sorted chronologically
The default sort order is newest first (most recent at top)
Each entry shows a title or summary and timestamp
The chronological display makes narrative progression clear
Entries from the current session appear immediately

User Story: As a player, I want to select entries to view their complete content so I can read the full details.
Acceptance Criteria:
Selecting an entry displays its full content in the EntryDetail view
The detail view shows the complete entry with proper formatting
Entry selection is intuitive and responsive
An empty state message appears if no entries exist
The currently selected entry is visually highlighted in the list

User Story: As a player, I want proper formatting in entries so they're easy to read and understand.
Acceptance Criteria:
The EntryDetail view renders content with paragraph breaks
Text formatting (bold, italic, etc.) is preserved when present
Different entry types have appropriate styling
Formatting is consistent across all entries
Text is readable with appropriate font size and spacing

User Story: As a player, I want journal styling that matches my world theme so it feels integrated with the game.
Acceptance Criteria:
The journal interface uses colors and fonts consistent with the world theme
Visual elements (borders, backgrounds, etc.) match the game aesthetic
Entry styling reflects the world's tone and setting
The theming is subtle and enhances readability
Theme elements are consistently applied throughout the journal

User Story: As a player, I want the journal interface to work well on different devices so I can play anywhere.
Acceptance Criteria:
The layout adapts for mobile, tablet, and desktop screens
Touch interactions work properly on mobile devices
Text remains readable on all screen sizes
Navigation controls are accessible on all devices
Performance is consistent across different devices

User Story: As a player, I want my journal to persist between game sessions so I don't lose my story history.
Acceptance Criteria:
Journal entries are stored and correctly loaded between sessions
New entries are properly integrated with existing entries
Entry order and formatting are maintained across sessions
No data loss occurs between game sessions
The journal loads quickly when accessed in a new session
